intro: Funastrum glaziovii, commonly known as the Mexican star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Funastrum glaziovii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
